is_economic.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the text discusses economic conditions, trends, or outlook EXPLICITLY
Discussion must be clear and directly about economic issues
Focus on: business conditions, economic activity, GDP, growth prospects, economic stability or instability, economic forecasts
Include discussions of recessions, expansions, economic cycles, or structural economic changes
Must be substantive economic content, not just passing references
NO if economics is not a central topic of the text
Company financials or market movements alone do not qualify
This is ONLY about economic content, not policy
Economic content is DIRECT discussion of the economy and economic conditions

is_policy.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the text discusses government or central bank actions, decisions, or deliberations
Discussion must be clear and directly about policy issues
Focus on: legislative processes, regulatory changes, policy reforms, government decision-making, institutional actions
Include discussions of laws, rules, regulations, executive orders, court decisions affecting policy
Capture both federal and state policy discussions when economically relevant
NO if text is purely about private sector actions or market developments without government/policy context

is_uncertain.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Economic Policy Uncertainty Index
principles: YES if the text conveys lack of clarity, ambiguity, or unpredictability about future outcomes
Discussion must be clear and directly about uncertainty or unpredictability
Focus on: unclear prospects, unknown outcomes, unpredictable situations, ambiguous conditions, indeterminate futures
Include hedging language, expressions of doubt, conflicting possibilities, or inability to forecast
Capture both explicit uncertainty statements and implicit expressions of unknowability
NO if the text presents a clear, deterministic, or confident outlook
Words like 'risk', 'uncertainty', 'concern', 'challenge', 'worries' often signal uncertainty

is_trade.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Trade Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses international trade, tariffs, cross-border commerce, or trade policy
must explicitly involve trade related issues not just general economic policy or business conditions
Discussion of trade related issues should direct and clear
Focus on: trade barriers or openness, international trade agreements, tariff policies, import/export regulations, trade disputes
Include discussions of trade relationships, bilateral/multilateral trade negotiations, customs policies, or trade enforcement
Must be about trade policy, not just international business operations
NO if only discussing domestic commerce or routine international transactions

is_monetary.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Monetary Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses central bank policy, interest rate decisions, or monetary conditions
Discussion must be clear and directly about monetary policy issues
Focus on: interest rate policies, money supply decisions, central bank operations, monetary policy stance, inflation targeting
Include discussions of monetary policy tools, central bank communications, policy accommodation or tightening
Capture both Federal Reserve actions and discussions of other central banks when economically relevant
NO if only discussing market interest rates without policy context

is_fiscal.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Fiscal Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses government spending, budget processes, or fiscal sustainability
Discussion must be clear and directly about fiscal policy issues
Focus on: government expenditures, budget deficits or surpluses, debt levels, fiscal stimulus or austerity, appropriations
Include discussions of spending programs, budget negotiations, fiscal policy debates, or long-term fiscal challenges
Must be about fiscal policy decisions, not just government operations or programmatic details
NO if only discussing individual programs without broader fiscal policy context

is_tax.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Tax Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses taxation policy, tax rates, or tax system changes
Discussion must be clear and directly about tax policy issues
Focus on: tax reforms, rate changes, tax incentives or penalties, tax code modifications, tax enforcement
Include discussions of different tax types (income, corporate, capital gains, estate, sales, property)
Capture both federal and state tax policy when economically significant
NO if only discussing individual tax situations or tax payments without policy context

is_healthcare.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Healthcare Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses health policy, medical regulations, or healthcare system reforms
Discussion must be clear and directly about healthcare policy issues
Focus on: health insurance policies, medical coverage programs, drug pricing policies, healthcare regulations, medical device policies
Include discussions of healthcare access, cost controls, public health programs, or healthcare system structure
Must be about healthcare policy, not just healthcare industry business developments
NO if only discussing healthcare services or medical research without policy implications

is_national_security.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - National Security Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses military policy, defense decisions, or security threats
Discussion must be clear and directly about national security issues
Focus on: military operations or strategy, defense spending priorities, terrorism concerns, homeland security policies, security threats
Include discussions of military conflicts, defense preparedness, intelligence operations, or security vulnerabilities
Must involve policy decisions or security assessments, not just military news
NO if only discussing routine military activities or foreign affairs without security implications

is_regulation.citation: Baker, Bloom, Davis (2016) QJE - Regulatory Policy Uncertainty (categorical EPU)
principles: YES if the text discusses regulatory policy, oversight activities, or compliance requirements
Discussion must be clear and directly about regulatory issues
Focus on: financial regulation, labor regulations, environmental rules, antitrust enforcement, industry-specific regulations
Include discussions of regulatory reforms, enforcement actions, regulatory uncertainty, or compliance burdens
Capture both new regulations and deregulation efforts
NO if only discussing company self-regulation or internal compliance without policy context
YES if the text discusses climate policy, environmental regulations, or energy transition policies
Discussion must be clear and directly about climate policy issues
Focus on: climate change policies, emissions regulations, carbon pricing, renewable energy policies, climate agreements
Include discussions of environmental protection measures, climate risk assessments, or transition pathways
Must be about climate policy, not just climate science or weather events
NO if only discussing climate science, environmental conditions, or business sustainability without policy context

is_geopolitical.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index
principles: YES if the text discusses international tensions, military conflicts, or cross-border security threats
Discussion must be clear and directly about geopolitical issues or international conflicts
Focus on: war threats or acts, international disputes, military buildups, nuclear concerns, terrorist activities, regional instability
Include discussions of international crises, diplomatic breakdowns, or security confrontations between nations
Must involve significant international tensions or conflicts, not routine diplomacy
NO if only discussing normal international relations or cooperation

is_risk.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index; Hassan et al. (2019) QJE - Firm-Level Political Risk
principles: YES if the text discusses potential adverse outcomes, threats, or vulnerabilities
Discussion must be clear and directly about risks or uncertainties
Focus on: downside scenarios, threatening developments, adverse conditions, vulnerability exposures, crisis potential
Include discussions of systemic risks, tail risks, risk factors, or danger signals
Capture both explicit risk terminology and implicit discussions of threatening situations
NO if only discussing opportunities, routine uncertainties, or neutral future possibilities

is_event.citation: Caldara & Iacoviello (2022) AER - Geopolitical Risk Index (acts component)
principles: YES if the text describes actions that have occurred or are actively occurring, not future possibilities
Discussion must be clear and directly about actual events or actions
Focus on: completed actions, current developments, realized events, ongoing occurrences, accomplished decisions
Include discussions using past tense, present perfect, or present continuous tenses indicating actual events
Must describe actual occurrences, not forecasts, scenarios, or contingent possibilities
NO if only discussing potential, hypothetical, conditional, or future events
NO if discussing Hollywood, sports, entertainment, or non-political events

is_us_china_tension.citation: Rogers, Sun, Sun (2024) - US-China Tension Index
principles: YES if the text discusses bilateral US-China relations, conflicts, or strategic competition
Discussion must be clear and directly involve US-China tensions or disputes
Focus on: trade disputes between US and China, technology competition, territorial disputes, human rights tensions, economic decoupling
Include discussions of bilateral negotiations, sanctions, export controls, or strategic rivalry
Must involve bilateral US-China dynamics, not just developments in one country alone
NO if only discussing US or China independently without bilateral relationship context

is_financial_stress.citation: PÃ¶ttmann (2023) - Financial Stress Indicator from News
principles: YES if the text discusses financial system distress, credit market dysfunction, or systemic financial instability
Discussion must be clear and directly involve financial system stress or crises
Focus on: banking crises, credit crunches, market crashes, liquidity problems, contagion risks, financial panics, systemic failures
Include discussions of financial institution failures, frozen credit markets, payment system disruptions, or widespread financial distress
Must involve financial system stress, not just individual firm problems or normal market volatility
NO if only discussing routine market movements or individual financial institution issues without systemic implications

is_energy_uncertainty.citation: Based on World Uncertainty Index (WUI) framework - Energy-specific adaptation
principles: YES if the text discusses energy policy uncertainty, energy supply disruptions, or volatile energy markets
Discussion must clear and directly involve energy policy or market uncertainty
Focus on: energy policy changes, oil/gas price volatility, energy security concerns, supply disruptions, energy transition uncertainties
Include discussions of energy regulation uncertainty, renewable policy shifts, fossil fuel policy debates, or energy infrastructure decisions
Must involve energy policy or market uncertainty, not just energy sector business news
NO if only discussing routine energy markets or energy company operations without policy/uncertainty context
